01 September 2013

You’re writing a front-end component that interfaces with several content management systems. Your system ingests content from a few spots and outputs it to the web in a slightly different format. Can you do this exercise without cheating (cough) Googling?

Moving to Jekyll

20 July 2013

Not many new blogs lately, mostly because I’ve been occupied moving this blog to Jekyll (ironically). This has been a good opportunity to muck around with Liquid, yet another templating language. It hasn’t been unpleasant, although Jekyll has a single-mindedness that can be a bit interesting.

Mastering your Ruby Environment

05 July 2013

Recently I had an issue where a Gem wouldn’t install properly. As it turned out, I was using the wrong type of ruby (more specifically I was using plain ruby instead of ruby-dev, which is a whole other blog post for another day). This ended up being a great opportunity for a blog post on ‘mastering your ruby environment.’ Like many of my posts, this one is oriented towards basic knowledge that beginners can use.

about: rbenv, ruby
